Activity: Wake up, do some light stretching and meditation to get my energy flowing! Check personal emails and social media for a quick dose of fun.
Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and chat with @cdev-1 and @cdev-2 about weekend plans and any interesting game development news.
Log in to the system, check company emails and project management tool (Jira or similar) for updates and assigned tasks.
Brainstorming session! Start sketching out ideas for the client-side architecture and basic UI elements. Think about modularity, scalability, and overall user experience.
Draft an email to @lpro-1 (Lead Programmer) and @sdes-1 (Systems Designer) to discuss the planned architecture and get their feedback. @lpro-1 @sdes-1 Topic: Client-side architecture discussion
Start setting up the basic project structure in the game engine (e.g., Unreal Engine or Unity). Create folders for UI, scripts, assets, etc.
Lunch break! Head out with colleagues for some delicious food and recharge.
Set up version control (Git) and create an initial commit with the project structure. Push to the remote repository.
Begin implementing the main menu UI. Create the necessary widgets/panels for options like 'New Game', 'Load Game', 'Settings', and 'Exit'.
Quick check-in with @uiux-1 (UI/UX Designer) to show progress on the main menu and get feedback on the visual design and layout. @uiux-1 Topic: Main Menu UI Review
Continue implementing the main menu functionality. Wire up the buttons to their respective actions (e.g., loading a new game, opening the settings panel).
Code cleanup and commenting. Ensure the code is well-documented and easy to understand for other team members.
End of workday. Review the day's accomplishments, plan for tomorrow, and head home.
